channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken bollard, 19th December
item.description:
The bollard highlighting a zebra crossing ahead has been broken at the base. It is sited just after the bridge on the approach to the zebra crossing making it more dangerous to cross.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves and moss on pathway, 19th December
item.description:
Following heavy rain the leaves on the pathway are very slippery in addition to this there is a coating of moss posing a health & safety slip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ash Row, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped in the woods., 19th December
item.description:
Please refer to the What3words reference to find this in Bursted Wood. The ref is- Lodge. Flies. Dark. There is a huge container full of beer cans and bottles which is overflowing. There is a broken plastic two seater chair, a blue child's table, a wooden table, a shopping trolley, a black office chair, a football, food containers and wrappers strewn all over the ground.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on Purbrook Estate, 19th December
item.description:
Rubbish and Fly- tipping left outside the bin area on Purbrook Estate for over a week. Please remove. Fly- tipping negatively affects the appearance of the estate and can encourages even more anti-social behaviour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Purbrook Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned wooden cabinet in street, 19th December
item.description:
Outside 81 Crofton Road. Been there more than a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Crofton Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 19th December
item.description:
There is a dead fox under the stairs between 182 and 184 Shooters Hill Road. It's starting to smell.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shooters Hill Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gravel on the road, 19th December
item.description:
I first reported this on the 17th November. You have replied to say that it has been dealt with. This is an ongoing issue because I'm not sure who you sent but the gravel is all still there! It's all over and around the zebra crossing and still in the middle of the road opposite the Sainsbury's car park. If I can attach photos you would see for yourself. It looks very unsightly and messy as the stones have also been spread all over the place amongst the leaves and rubbish that collects at that junction
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 19th December
item.description:
White graffiti on green electric box and purple graffiti on brick, corner of vicarage grove

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Church Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another dog poo log, 19th December
item.description:
Pavement outside 41 Powerscroft (this is in addition to the 2 I reported earlier today). Please patrol this street. Obviously someone is walking their big dog here and not cleaning up after it. Absolutely disgusting as this is a major route for school kids

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole street, 19th December
item.description:
This pavement on the whole street is too low and not seen by so many people. Iâ€™m a trader on this street and saw 5 people falling over not seeing it and injuring themselves. I just wanted to give you a general feedback.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Earlham Street, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside hardware shop, 19th December
item.description:
Huge pothole damaged my wheel. Very deep, near the curb, on the same side of the street as the Tube Station.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Heath Street, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned van obstructing traffic, 19th December
item.description:
Van parked on 16 November and not moved since. Parked dangerously close to junction obscuring view off those emerging from side road and the cause of at least one accident I know about. On a route frequently used by learner drivers causing tailbacks while learners edge out to gain view of major road traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Crescent, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked access and rubbish, 19th December
item.description:
Parked vehicles blocking access to flats /shops and property. Rubbish dumped and left , large bins left there despite not allowed to block access. Site cleared by locals 3 times and keeps happening. Need council support

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Job marked complete- but not, 19th December
item.description:
13.30pm job marked COMPLETE by Fix my Street. But no action has been taken. See photo. Is there a problem with the app? Bags of rubbish on Lynmouth Road were reported via this app. Marked complete, but notWhat's going wrong? This is happening repeatedly.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oldhill Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
